Last night, around 20 Russian Geran-2 drones attacked a warehouse complex in the village of Novi Petrivtsi, Kyiv Oblast.
Coordinates: 50.61762, 30.43356

Last night, around 20 Russian Geran-2 drones attacked a warehouse complex in the village of Novi Petrivtsi, Kyiv Oblast.
Coordinates: 50.61762, 30.43356

A large Russian Telegram Channel with over 25,000 subscribers called "ZAPAD Military Group | News" appears to be paraphrasing my posts on the situation in Kupyansk, and lying about their connections. 
This channel claims to be in contact with many soldiers currently fighting in the Zapad Group of the Russian Army and even says that they communicate with family members of soldiers.
One of their recent posts - published just four hours after my own Kupyansk map update - contains large parts of my text paraphrased to make it look like their own, with key terms such as "strongpoint" and "substation" left in, making the copying very obvious. I have highlighted these instances it in the attached image if you wish to take a closer look.
Additionally, if you look closer at their channel, their maps are just edited versions of 
@Suriyak_maps
' maps, with large grey zones present.
You would think that an account so connected with an army group who posts updates so often would have their own information, and wouldn't regurgitate information posted by a pro-Ukrainian account like me?
It's likely that this account is a fraud, so if you are looking for updates on this direction, please don't treat it as reliable, and especially don't treat it as a "Russian source". It's possible that it is ran by Ukrainians, or at the very least Russians who want some views and exposure on Telegram.

Russian forces have captured the village of Varvarivka, Hulyaipole direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~368.
Total land area: ~2.12 km¬≤.
Last night, at least 5 Russian Geran-2 drones attacked an agricultural complex on the outskirts of the town of Novomykolaivka, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
2 Russian Su-34s covered by 2 Su-35 fighters are airborne over the Black Sea. They may launch glide-bombs at Odesa Oblast.
2 Russian Su-34s covered by 2 Su-35 fighters are airborne over the Black Sea. They may launch glide-bombs at Odesa Oblast.
Both are Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bombs. Flying in the direction of Chornomorsk.
Both are Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bombs. Flying in the direction of Chornomorsk.

Approaching Sanzhiika, Odesa Oblast. 
~20 km away.
Approaching Sanzhiika, Odesa Oblast.   ~20 km away.
1 of the glide-bombs was shot down around 15 km from the coast. The other impacted.
The missile which shot it down. Likely an IRIS-T.
At least six Russian Geran-2 drones are now flying to attack the same target near Sanzhiika, Odesa Oblast.
At least six Russian Geran-2 drones are now flying to attack the same target near Sanzhiika, Odesa Oblast.
Correction: they are flying further north and attacking the Velykodolyns'ke area, near Odesa City.

Over the last few days, the Ukrainian defence of Hulyaipole has begun to collapse. As a result, Russian forces now control more than 55% of the city.
This is occurring mainly due to superior Russian manpower and firepower, a complete lack of coordination between Ukrainian units, and the heavy losses suffered by Ukraine during the Russian advances and encirclements east of Hulyaipole.

Russian Army Approaches Borova, Makes Gains Around Vovchansk (Videos)
On December 16, the Russian military moved closer to Borova by capturing an important settlement nearby, all while expanding its control around Vovchansk to the north in Kharkiv.
The capture of Novoplatonovka, located right to the north of Borova, by the Zapad [West] Group of Forces was announced by the Russian Ministry of Defense.
To the north in Kharkiv, the Sever [North] Group of Forces expanded its control around Vovchansk in three different directions.
Read more

Systematic Russian Offensive In Kharkiv: Ukraine Loses Ground Near Melovoye And Vilcha
In the Siversk area, Russian forces have begun clearing the northern flank, which includes Mine No. 6. In the Kharkiv sector, the Russian army has made substantial advances in the Melovoye and Vilcha areas. In the Konstantynivka area, Russian forces have reached the outskirts of Stepanivka. 
The U.S. has given Kyiv a tight deadline to accept the proposed security guarantees.
Read more 
HERE

UAE Was Behind Record-Breaking Sensitive Defense Deal With Israel‚Äôs Elbit Systems
The country behind a massive defense deal Israel‚Äôs Elbit Systems announced about a month ago is none other than the United Arab Emirates, the French security-focused outlet Intelligence Online reported on December 15.
Valued at approximately $2.3 billion, the deal is the largest and most opaque sale in the history of the defense company. It was concluded with the mediation and full involvement of the Israeli Ministry of Defense.
Elbit Systems is a well-known producer of artillery systems, precision guided munitions, and drones. More importantly, the defense company produces advanced signal intelligence systems and optical components for spy satellites.
Read more 
HERE

Fall Of Volchansk: Ukrainian POW Testimonies On The Collapse Of Defenses
Russian forces have recently assumed full control of Vovchansk on the Kharkiv axis. Testimonies from Ukrainian POWs of the 57th and 58th Brigades reveal internal chaos within their positions, where assault groups were being destroyed at a staggering rate.
Vladimir Petrenko, from the 57th Brigade, was captured after ten days spent in the basement of a two-story building. "They told us to settle in there, barricade ourselves, and 'zinc,'" he recalled, clarifying that "to zinc" meant standing watch by the hour to adjust fire.
The situation with both reinforcements and training was critical. Viktor Shut and Artem Sadovyi from the 58th Brigade surrendered voluntarily after two weeks in Vovchansk. They served as BMP gunners but had barely any training. "They took me after I went AWOL," Shut admitted. According to them, only two positions remained in front of their sector in Vovchansk ‚Äî the rest were deserted.
üëâ

Trump Announces Complete Oil Blockade On Venezuela In Push To Topple Maduro
United States President Donald Trump ordered on December 16 a "total and complete blockade" of all sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela, designating the government of the country as a "foreign terrorist organization".
The announcement brought the U.S. pressure campaign on Venezuela, which began back in October and escalated into a military operation against drug traffickers in September, to a whole new level.
Venezuela said that the campaign is aimed at allowing ‚Äúexternal powers to rob its immeasurable oil and gas wealth‚Äú, even before U.S. forces seized a sanctioned oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela last week, with Trump later telling reporters, ‚ÄúI assume we‚Äôre going to keep the oil.‚Äù
Since the seizure, a de-facto blockade has been in place, with oil tankers staying in Venezuelan waters rather than risk seizure. This led to a sharp decline in the country‚Äôs oil exports.
Read more 
HERE
